bibl.title: Toparchies in the Arsinoite Nome: A Study in Administration of the Fayum in the Roman Period.
bibl.note: Introduction. - The toparchies in the Fayum. The case of doubled toparchies. - Toparchies in the Fayum and their villages. - Remarks on some documents. - Two or one? A single toparchy with two numbers or two toparchies paired off? - Contradiction within the evidence. - The officials connected with the toparchies in the first period of numbered toparchies (AD 111-161). - The officials connected with the toparchies after the reintroduction of the toparchies in the 240s. - Historical analysis of the data. - Conclusion. - Passages corrected.
bibl.seg: DERDA Tomasz, Toparchies in the Arsinoite Nome: A Study in Administration of the Fayum in the Roman Period.

Introduction. - The toparchies in the Fayum. The case of doubled toparchies. - Toparchies in the Fayum and their villages. - Remarks on some documents. - Two or one? A single toparchy with two numbers or two toparchies paired off? - Contradiction within the evidence. - The officials connected with the toparchies in the first period of numbered toparchies (AD 111-161). - The officials connected with the toparchies after the reintroduction of the toparchies in the 240s. - Historical analysis of the data. - Conclusion. - Passages corrected.
